newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese police seize cocaine on Cypriot ship.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese police seize cocaine on Cypriot ship.

text.p: Portuguese police have seized 20.3 kg (45 lb) of cocaine worth millions of dollars hidden in a Cypriot cargo vessel, a police spokeswoman said on Monday.

Maria Firmina said police confiscated the drug after a Portuguese worker repairing a turbine found a suspicious package hidden in the hull of the Curacao Freeze while it was docked for repairs in Lisbon on Sunday.
She told Reuters police suspected that one of the 28-strong crew, who included Greeks, Cypriots, Poles and Filipinos, was responsible for smuggling the cocaine on board.
No one had been arrested but the crew members remained on the ship while police continued their investigations, she added.
The cargo transported by the vessel, which had arrived from Ventspils in Latvia, was not known.
